instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Good morning, mac power on when you disconnect the battery or SSD.
       It was repaired in the <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> region, where it had oxidation. There was rust on the SSD connector and the SSD.
       I did the ASD test, he found no defects. Can you tell me what could be causing this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
It only starts without SSD, or without battery connected?
I do not understand what you mean to say exactly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: The MacBook turns on only after disconnecting the battery reconnecting it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Please, find another way to translate your messages to english.
Calla friend to help you online with the posts.
